Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there are no drugs that have been proven to be effective in treating Covid-19.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of repurposed drugs in treating Covid-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that repurposed drugs are effective in treating Covid-19 without providing adequate evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations and treatments recommended by experts, such as vaccines and dexamethasone.
